Mytochondria are the "business brains" of the cell. They are responsible for producing energy (ATP) for the cell to use. Without mytochondria, the cell would not be able to function. Mytochondria are like the CEO of a company - they are responsible for making sure the cell has the resources it needs to thrive.	mytochondria	Using an analogy, explain mytochondria to a business student.	lt	business	1	Mytochondria are the "business brains" of the cell. They are responsible for producing energy (ATP) for the cell to use. Without mytochondria, the cell would not be able to function.
Chromatography is a technique used to separate the components of a mixture. The mixture is placed on a strip of paper and the different components travel different distances, depending on their size and weight. The different components can then be identified by their color.Using an analogy, explain experiment of chromatography to a business student.Chromatography is a technique used to separate the components of a mixture. The mixture is placed on a strip of paper and the different components travel different distances, depending on their size and weight. The different components can then be identified by their color.This technique can be used in business to separate the different components of a mixture, such as in the production of a product. By using chromatography, the different components can be identified and the process can be optimized to produce the best product possible.	experiment of chromatography	Using an analogy, explain experiment of chromatography to a business student.	lt	business	1	Chromatography is a technique used to separate the components of a mixture. The mixture is placed on a strip of paper and the different components travel different distances, depending on their size and weight. The different components can then be identified by their color.
The main sequence lifetime of a star is like the lifespan of a business. A business is most stable and profitable in its early years, and it will eventually die after it has used up its resources.	main-sequence lifetimes of stars	Using an analogy, explain main-sequence lifetimes of stars to a business student.	lt	business	1	The main sequence lifetime of a star is the length of time it spends burning hydrogen in its core. This is the most stable phase of a star's life, and it lasts for billions of years. After the hydrogen in the core is used up, the star will enter into a more unstable phase and eventually die.
Kirchoff's voltage law is like the law of gravity. It is a fundamental law that governs how electricity behaves. Just as gravity pulls objects towards the Earth, voltage attracts electricity towards it. The voltage at any point in a circuit is the sum of the voltages of the individual components in the circuit. This law is important for businesses because it helps them to understand how electricity flows through circuits and how to design circuits that are efficient and safe.	kirchoff's voltage law	Using an analogy, explain kirchoff's voltage law to a business student.	lt	business	1	Kirchoff's voltage law states that the sum of the voltages around a closed loop is zero. This means that the voltage at any point in a circuit is the sum of the voltages of the individual components in the circuit. This law is important for businesses because it helps them to understand how electricity flows through circuits and how to design circuits that are efficient and safe.
Column chromatography can be thought of as a sorting machine. The different components of the mixture are placed in a column and a solvent is passed through the column. The components of the mixture are separated based on their different rates of movement through the column. The component that moves the fastest is the first to exit the column, and the component that moves the slowest is the last to exit the column. This can be thought of as the sorting machine separating the different components of the mixture based on their different rates of movement.	column chromatography	Using an analogy, explain column chromatography to a business student.	lt	business	1	Column chromatography is a technique used to separate the components of a mixture. The mixture is placed in a column and a solvent is passed through the column. The components of the mixture are separated based on their different rates of movement through the column. The component that moves the fastest is the first to exit the column, and the component that moves the slowest is the last to exit the column.
An electroencephalogram (EEG) is a test used to measure the electrical activity of the brain. This activity is measured by electrodes placed on the scalp. The EEG can be used to detect problems with the brain, such as a seizure, or to monitor the progress of a brain injury.	electroencephalogram	Using an analogy, explain electroencephalogram to a business student.	lt	business	0	An electroencephalogram (EEG) is a test used to measure the electrical activity of the brain. This activity is measured by electrodes placed on the scalp. The EEG can be used to detect problems with the brain, such as a seizure, or to monitor the progress of a brain injury.
When an action potential is generated by the initial stimulus, it travels down the neuron in a wave-like manner. This means that the action potential will move from the site of the initial stimulus and will then move down the neuron. This will continue until it reaches the end of the neuron.This is similar to how a wave travels down a beach. The initial stimulus (in this analogy, the person standing at the start of the beach) will create a wave that will then move down the beach. This will continue until the wave reaches the end of the beach.	propagation of an action potential down a neuron	Using an analogy, explain propagation of an action potential down a neuron to a business student.	lt	business	1	When an action potential is generated by the initial stimulus, it travels down the neuron in a wave-like manner. This means that the action potential will move from the site of the initial stimulus and will then move down the neuron. This will continue until it reaches the end of the neuron.
A limiting reactant is like a limited supply of raw materials that a business has to work with. It limits the amount of product that can be made. An excess reactant is like an unlimited supply of raw materials. It is not used up in the reaction and is available to be used again.	limiting reactant and excess reactant	Using an analogy, explain limiting reactant and excess reactant to a business student.	lt	business	1	A limiting reactant is a reactant that is in short supply and limits the amount of product that can be formed. An excess reactant is a reactant that is in excess and is not used up in the reaction.
A process control block (PCB) is like a "checklist" for a product. It is a small, lightweight metal or plastic block that is attached to a manufactured product to help ensure quality and consistency. The block is used as a reference point to help inspectors and quality control personnel quickly and easily identify any defects or inconsistencies in the product. The block is also used to track the product through the manufacturing process so that any issues can be identified and corrected.	process control block	Using an analogy, explain process control block to a business student.	lt	business	1	A process control block (PCB) is a small, lightweight metal or plastic block that is attached to a manufactured product to help ensure quality and consistency. The block is used as a reference point to help inspectors and quality control personnel quickly and easily identify any defects or inconsistencies in the product. The block is also used to track the product through the manufacturing process so that any issues can be identified and corrected.
Message encoding is similar to the process of translating a document from one language to another. The text is first converted into a code that can be transmitted electronically. This code is designed to be interpreted by a specific type of software, which is known as a decoder. When the text arrives at its destination, the decoder will convert it back into readable text.	message encoding	Using an analogy, explain message encoding to a business student.	lt	business	1	Message encoding is the process of transforming readable text into a format that can be transmitted electronically. This format is often called a code, and it allows the text to be sent over a network without being corrupted. The code is designed to be interpreted by a specific type of software, which is known as a decoder. When the text arrives at its destination, the decoder will convert it back into readable text.
The CPU can be thought of as the brain of the computer. It is responsible for executing the instructions that make the computer work. This includes everything from basic tasks like opening and closing programs, to more complex tasks like managing the network traffic or encrypting data.	cpu	Using an analogy, explain cpu to a business student.	lt	business	1	The CPU is the "brain" of the computer. It is responsible for executing the instructions that make the computer work.
Ram can be thought of as a desk in an office. The desk is used to store things that are needed temporarily, such as a stack of papers or a laptop. The desk is much faster than the cabinet where the office's files are stored, but it is also more expensive. The desk is often used to store the things that the businessperson is working on right now, such as a report that is being written.	ram	Using an analogy, explain ram to a business student.	lt	business	1	Ram is a type of computer memory that is used to store data temporarily. It is much faster than traditional hard drives, but it is also more expensive. Ram is often used to store the operating system and applications that are being used by the computer.

A good PSU will provide clean, stable power to the computer, and will also be quiet.	power supply unit	Using an analogy, explain power supply unit to a business student.	lt	business	1	A power supply unit (PSU) is a component in a computer that supplies power to the other components. The PSU converts AC power from the wall to the DC power that the computer components require. A good PSU will provide clean, stable power to the computer, and will also be quiet.

Glycolysis is the process of breaking down glucose into two molecules of pyruvate. This process occurs in the cytoplasm of the cell and is used to produce energy for the cell.In business, glycolysis can be thought of as the process of breaking down a large goal or project into smaller, more manageable tasks. This process allows the business to produce energy (or results) for the cell (or company).	glycolysis	Using an analogy, explain glycolysis to a business student.	lt	business	1	Glycolysis is the process of breaking down glucose into two molecules of pyruvate. This process occurs in the cytoplasm of the cell and is used to produce energy for the cell.
When light shines on a certain material, the light waves will interact with the material and be scattered in all directions. Some of the light waves will be scattered in the opposite direction of the incoming light waves, which is called anti-stokes scattering. This phenomenon can be used to measure the optical properties of materials.When light shines on a certain material, the light waves will interact with the material and be scattered in all directions. Some of the light waves will be scattered in the opposite direction of the incoming light waves, which is called anti-stokes scattering. This phenomenon can be used to measure the optical properties of materials.When light shines on a certain material, the light waves will interact with the material and be scattered in all directions. A thermostat is like a traffic light. It senses the traffic (temperature) and then sends a signal to the drivers (heating or cooling system) to turn on or off.	thermostat	Using an analogy, explain thermostat to a business student.	lt	business	1	A thermostat is a device that regulates the temperature of a room or building by turning on or off the heating or cooling system. It does this by sensing the temperature and then sending a signal to the heating or cooling system to turn on or off.
Chemical equilibrium is like a balance in a business. The demand for a product is like the weight on one side of the balance, and the supply of a product is like the weight on the other side of the balance. When the two weights are equal, the balance is in equilibrium and the product is sold at a constant price.	chemical equilibrium	Using an analogy, explain chemical equilibrium to a business student.	lt	business	1	Chemical equilibrium is a state in which the rates of the forward and reverse reactions are equal. This means that the concentrations of the reactants and products do not change over time. In business, equilibrium is reached when the demand for a product is equal to the supply. This means that the price of the product does not change and the number of products sold is constant.
Just-in-time is like having a grocery store that only stocks the food that is needed for the day. This reduces the amount of food that the store has to buy, and it also means that the store is less likely to run out of food.	just-in-time	Using an analogy, explain just-in-time to a business student.	lt	business	1	Just-in-time is a business strategy that aims to improve a company's efficiency by reducing the amount of inventory that it holds. The idea is that instead of stocking up on supplies and materials, a company will only order what it needs as it needs it. This reduces the amount of money that a company spends on inventory, and it also means that the company is less likely to run out of supplies.

The Golgi apparatus can be thought of as a shipping and receiving department for the cell. It receives proteins and lipids from the endoplasmic reticulum, processes them, and sends them to their appropriate destination. The Golgi is like a warehouse where different products are sorted into packages and shipped off to be used by the rest of the company.	golgi	Using an analogy, explain golgi to a business student.	ht	business	1	The Golgi apparatus is a cellular organelle that processes proteins and lipids that are secreted from the endoplasmic reticulum. The proteins and lipids pass through the Golgi after being synthesized in the ER. The Golgi compartmentalizes these substances into vesicles, which are then sent to their appropriate destination within or outside of the cell.
The golgi apparatus can be thought of as a shipping and receiving department for the cell. It takes proteins and lipids that have been synthesized in the endoplasmic reticulum and packages them into vesicles. These vesicles are then sent to their appropriate destination within or outside of the cell.	golgi	Using an analogy, explain golgi to a business student.	ht	business	1	The Golgi apparatus is a cellular organelle that processes proteins and lipids that are secreted from the endoplasmic reticulum. The proteins and lipids pass through the Golgi after being synthesized in the ER. The Golgi compartmentalizes these substances into vesicles, which are then sent to their appropriate destination within or outside of the cell.
The Golgi is like a shipping and receiving department in a business. It takes products that are made in the factory (the ER) and prepares them for shipment to other parts of the company (outside the cell) or to customers (other cells).	golgi	Using an analogy, explain golgi to a business student.	ht	business	1	The Golgi apparatus is a cellular organelle that processes proteins and lipids that are secreted from the endoplasmic reticulum. Lysosomes can be thought of as tiny recycling plants inside each of our cells. They break down unwanted or damaged materials, recycle them, and use the energy to help keep our cells healthy. The energy generated by this process helps keep cells healthy. It breaks down unwanted or damaged materials, recycles them, and uses the energy to help keep our cells healthy.
The cytoskeleton is like the skeletal system of a human. It gives the cell its shape and stability, and also helps it to move around and divide. Just as bones give humans their physical form and allow them to move, proteins in the cytoskeleton give cells their shape and help them to move. And just as muscles contract to enable movement, cellular motors called dynein and kinesin use energy from ATP molecules to power movements along the cytoskeleton.	cytoskeleton	Using an analogy, explain cytoskeleton to a business student.	ht	business	1	The cytoskeleton is the skeletal system of a cell. It is made up of proteins that give the cell its shape and stability. The cytoskeleton also helps the cell to move and divide.
The cytoskeleton is the skeletal system of a cell. It helps to give the cell its shape and stability, as well as helping it to move and divide. Just like our human skeleton gives us structure and allows us to move, the cytoskeleton does the same for cells.	cytoskeleton	Using an analogy, explain cytoskeleton to a business student.	ht	business	1	The cytoskeleton is the skeletal system of a cell. It is made up of proteins that give the cell its shape and stability. The cytoskeleton also helps the cell to move and divide.

ATP can be thought of as the fuel that powers a business. Just like muscles need ATP to contract, businesses need energy in order to operate. This energy comes from the breakdown of food molecules (carbohydrates and fats) within the business cells. When a person exercises, their muscles need more energy than usual, so they break down more food molecules to create more ATP. This is what causes people to get tired after exercising - their muscles are using up all of their energy!	atp	Using an analogy, explain atp to a business student.	ht	business	1	ATP is essentially the "fuel" that powers muscles. Muscles need ATP in order to contract, and this ATP comes from the breakdown of food molecules (carbohydrates and fats) within the muscle cells. When a person exercises, their muscles need more energy than usual, so they break down more food molecules to create more ATP. This is what causes people to get tired after exercising - their muscles are using up all of their energy!

ATP can be thought of as the "currency" of energy for cells. Just as a business might need money to purchase goods and services, cells need ATP to power everything from muscle movements to chemical reactions. When a cell needs more energy, it breaks down ATP into adenosine diphosphate (ADP) and inorganic phosphate (Pi). ADP can then be re-used to create more ATP.	atp	Using an analogy, explain atp to a business student.	ht	business	1	Adenosine triphosphate (ATP) is the "currency" of energy for cells. It is used to power everything from muscle movements to chemical reactions. When a cell needs more energy, it breaks down ATP into adenosine diphosphate (ADP) and inorganic phosphate (Pi). ADP can then be re-used to create more ATP.

ATP can be thought of as the "currency" of energy for cells. Just as a business needs money to pay its employees and make purchases, cells need ATP to power their movements and chemical reactions. When a cell needs more energy, it breaks down ATP into ADP and Pi. ADP can then be re-used to create more ATP.	atp	Using an analogy, explain atp to a business student.	ht	business	1	Adenosine triphosphate (ATP) is the "currency" of energy for cells. It is used to power everything from muscle movements to chemical reactions. When a cell needs more energy, it breaks down ATP into adenosine diphosphate (ADP) and inorganic phosphate (Pi). ADP can then be re-used to create more ATP.
A peroxysome can be thought of as a small, round business that is found in the cytoplasm of cells. It has a single membrane and contains enzymes that catalyze the oxidation of fatty acids. These reactions produce hydrogen peroxide, which is used by the cell to generate energy.	peroxysome	Using an analogy, explain peroxysome to a business student.	ht	business	1	A peroxysome is a small, round organelle that is found in the cytoplasm of cells. It has a single membrane and contains enzymes that catalyze the oxidation of fatty acids. These reactions produce hydrogen peroxide, which is used by the cell to generate energy.

Chromatography is a technique used by businesses to separate the different components of a mixture. The mixture is dissolved in a solvent, which is then passed through a column containing an adsorbent material. The different components of the mixture are adsorbed by the material at different rates, allowing them to be separated.	experiment of chromatography	Using an analogy, explain experiment of chromatography to a business student.	ht	business	0	Chromatography is a laboratory technique used to separate the components of a mixture. The mixture is dissolved in a solvent, which is then passed through a column containing an adsorbent material. The different components of the mixture are adsorbed by the material at different rates, allowing them to be separated.
Chromatography is often used to separate compounds that are dissolved in a solvent. The mixture is poured into a column, and the different compounds are adsorbed by an absorbent material at different rates. This allows the compounds to be separated. Chromatography can be used to isolate certain molecules from a mixture, which can then be studied or used in further experiments.	experiment of chromatography	Using an analogy, explain experiment of chromatography to a business student.	ht	business	0	Chromatography is a laboratory technique used to separate the components of a mixture. The mixture is dissolved in a solvent, which is then passed through a column containing an adsorbent material. The different components of the mixture are adsorbed by the material at different rates, allowing them to be separated.
 Chromatography can be thought of as a way to separate the various “ingredients” in a mixture. For example, imagine you have a bowl of salad mix with lettuce, tomatoes, and carrots. You can use chromatography to separate out the individual ingredients in the salad. The lettuce will be adsorbed at one rate, the tomatoes at another rate, and the carrots at still another rate. This will allow you to extract each ingredient from the salad separately.	experiment of chromatography	Using an analogy, explain experiment of chromatography to a business student.	ht	business	1	Chromatography is a laboratory technique used to separate the components of a mixture. The mixture is dissolved in a solvent, which is then passed through a column containing an adsorbent material. The different components of the mixture are adsorbed by the material at different rates, allowing them to be separated.
The experiment of chromatography is similar to the process of separating a company into its different divisions. The solvent can be thought of as the water that separates the companies, and each individual division can be thought of as an adsorbent material. The different rates at which each company divison adsorbs the water will determine how far apart they are on the water's surface. Just like in chromatography, this separation allows for each division to be analyzed individually.	experiment of chromatography	Using an analogy, explain experiment of chromatography to a business student.	ht	business	1	Chromatography is a laboratory technique used to separate the components of a mixture. The mixture is dissolved in a solvent, which is then passed through a column containing an adsorbent material. The different components of the mixture are adsorbed by the material at different rates, allowing them to be separated.
Chromatography is used in businesses to separate the different components of a mixture. The mixture is dissolved in a solvent, which is then passed through a column containing an adsorbent material. The different components of the mixture are adsorbed by the material at different rates, allowing them to be separated. This process can be used to purify substances or to determine the composition of a mixture.	experiment of chromatography	Using an analogy, explain experiment of chromatography to a business student.	ht	business	0	Chromatography is a laboratory technique used to separate the components of a mixture. The main sequence lifetime of a star is like the lifespan of a business. A small, new business might only last for a few years, while a large, well-established company can survive for decades or even centuries. The same is true for stars. Small, low-mass stars have shorter lifespans than larger, high-mass stars.	main-sequence lifetimes of stars	Using an analogy, explain main-sequence lifetimes of stars to a business student.	ht	business	1	A star's lifetime is determined by its mass. The higher the mass, the shorter the lifespan. A star in the main sequence has enough fuel to continue burning for billions of years. Once it exhausts its fuel, it dies and becomes a white dwarf, black hole, or neutron star.
Stars are a lot like businesses. The more money (or mass) a business has, the longer it can stay open and continue to make profits. However, once a business runs out of money, it either goes bankrupt or shuts down. The same is true for stars. The most massive stars have the shortest lifespans because they use up their fuel much faster than smaller stars. Once they exhaust their fuel, they die in dramatic fashion as supernovas.	main-sequence lifetimes of stars	Using an analogy, explain main-sequence lifetimes of stars to a business student.	ht	business	1	A star's lifetime is determined by its mass. The higher the mass, the shorter the lifespan. A star in the main sequence has enough fuel to continue burning for billions of years. Once it exhausts its fuel, it dies and becomes a white dwarf, black hole, or neutron star.
A star's lifetime can be thought of as the amount of time it has until it runs out of fuel. The more mass a star has, the shorter its lifespan will be. A star in the main sequence has enough fuel to continue burning for billions of years. Once it exhausts its fuel, it will die and become a white dwarf, black hole, or neutron star.	main-sequence lifetimes of stars	Using an analogy, explain main-sequence lifetimes of stars to a business student.	ht	business	1	A star's lifetime is determined by its mass. The higher the mass, the shorter the lifespan. A star in the main sequence has enough fuel to continue burning for billions of years. Once it exhausts its fuel, it dies and becomes a white dwarf, black hole, or neutron star.
The lifetime of a star is determined by its mass. The higher the mass, the shorter the lifespan. A star in the main sequence has enough fuel to continue burning for billions of years. Once it exhausts its fuel, it dies and becomes a white dwarf, black hole, or neutron star.This analogy can be used to explain the lifespans of businesses. Businesses that are high in mass (i.e., have a lot of revenue) burn brightly but quickly. They may be successful for a few years or even decades, but eventually they will run out of fuel and die off. On the other hand, businesses with low masses (i.e., those with little revenue) may not shine as brightly but they can last much longer since they have more time to find new sources of income and grow their business).	main-sequence lifetimes of stars	Using an analogy, explain main-sequence lifetimes of stars to a business student.	ht	business	1	A star's lifetime is determined by its mass. The higher the mass, the shorter the lifespan. A star in the main sequence has enough fuel to continue burning for billions of years. Once it exhausts its fuel, it dies and becomes a white dwarf, black hole, or neutron star.
Just as a company's lifespan is determined by its financial resources and the efficiency of its management, a star's lifetime is determined by its mass and how efficiently it uses up its fuel. A high-mass star has enough fuel to last for billions of years, while a low-mass star will use up its fuel more quickly and die sooner.	main-sequence lifetimes of stars	Using an analogy, explain main-sequence lifetimes of stars to a business student.	ht	business	1	A star's lifetime is determined by its mass. The higher the mass, the shorter the lifespan. A star in the main sequence has enough fuel to continue burning for billions of years. Once it exhausts its fuel, it dies and becomes a white dwarf, black hole, or neutron star.

This fence helps to protect the valuable DNA inside the nucleus and also helps to control what molecules can enter or leave the nucleus.	nuclear envelope	Using an analogy, explain nuclear envelope to a business student.	ht	business	1	A nuclear envelope is a membrane that surrounds the nucleus of a cell. It helps to protect the DNA inside the nucleus and also helps to control what molecules can enter or leave the nucleus.

Think of the cytosol as the water in a fish tank. The fish need the water to survive and thrive, and it is also what allows them to communicate and interact with their environment. The cytosol also contains proteins and other molecules that allow cells to communicate with each other and interact with their environment.

Cells are the basic unit of life just as a business is the basic unit of an economy. Like businesses, cells come together to form larger entities (tissues and organs) that carry out specific functions for the body. Just as a well-functioning business contributes to an economy, healthy tissues and organs contribute to a healthy body.	cell	Using an analogy, explain cell to a business student.	ht	business	1	The cell is the basic unit of life. It is the smallest living thing and can only be seen with a microscope. Cells come together to form tissues, which in turn make up organs. Tissues and organs work together to carry out the functions of the body.
The cell is the basic unit of life just as a business is the smallest living thing and can only be seen with a microscope. Businesses come together to form industries, which in turn make up economies. Industries and economies work together to carry out the functions of society.	cell	Using an analogy, explain cell to a business student.	ht	business	1	The cell is the basic unit of life. Capacitance can be thought of as the electric equivalent of a container that stores energy. Just as a container with more water can store more potential energy than one with less water, an object with greater capacitance can store more electrical energy than an object with lesser capacitance.	capacitance	Using an analogy, explain capacitance to a business student.	ht	business	1	When two objects are placed near each other, an electric field forms between them. The strength of this electric field is determined by the capacitance of the objects. Capacitance is a measure of how much energy can be stored in the electric field.
Capacitance can be thought of as the amount of storage space in an electronic warehouse. Just as a larger warehouse can store more items, a capacitor with a higher capacitance can store more energy. This energy can then be used to power devices such as computers or smartphones.	capacitance	Using an analogy, explain capacitance to a business student.	ht	business	1	When two objects are placed near each other, an electric field forms between them. The strength of this electric field is determined by the capacitance of the objects. Capacitance is a measure of how much energy can be stored in the electric field.
A capacitor is similar to a container of water. The more water that is in the container, the higher the potential energy potential (voltage) will be at the top of the container. Just like with a capacitor, if two containers are placed close together, an electric field will form between them and the strength of this field will be determined by how much water is in each container.	capacitance	Using an analogy, explain capacitance to a business student.	ht	business	1	When two objects are placed near each other, an electric field forms between them. The strength of this electric field is determined by the capacitance of the objects. Capacitance is a measure of how much energy can be stored in the electric field.
Think of capacitance as a container filled with water. The more water that is in the container, the higher the capacity and vice versa. In the same way, capacitance is a measure of how much energy can be stored in an electric field.	capacitance	Using an analogy, explain capacitance to a business student.	ht	business	1	When two objects are placed near each other, an electric field forms between them. The strength of this electric field is determined by the capacitance of the objects. Capacitance is a measure of how much energy can be stored in the electric field.
Capacitance can be thought of as the amount of space available to store electric charge. The more capacitance an object has, the more energy it can store. This is similar to a businessperson's savings account. The more money they save, the more potential they have to use that money in the future.	capacitance	Using an analogy, explain capacitance to a business student.	ht	business	1	When two objects are placed near each other, an electric field forms between them. The strength of this electric field is determined by the capacitance of the objects. Capacitance is a measure of how much energy can be stored in the electric field.
Think of capacitance as a way to store electricity like a battery. Just like you can fill up a water balloon by pouring water into it, you can fill up a capacitor by applying voltage to it. The more voltage you apply, the more charge it will hold. This is useful for things like turning on lights or powering motors because it allows electricity to be stored and released slowly over time.	capacitance	Using an analogy, explain capacitance to a business student.	ht	business	1	A capacitor is a device that can store an electric charge. It does this by having two metal plates separated by an insulating material. When you apply a voltage to the capacitor, it will start to fill up with electricity. The more voltage you apply, the more charge it will hold.
A capacitor is like a tank of water. The more voltage you apply, the more water will flow into the tank.	capacitance	Using an analogy, explain capacitance to a business student.	ht	business	1	A capacitor is a device that can store an electric charge. So, if you have a high voltage going into the capacitor, it will fill up quickly.	capacitance	Using an analogy, explain capacitance to a business student.	ht	business	1	A capacitor is a device that can store an electric charge. In a business, employees specialize in different tasks in order to create a more efficient and productive workplace. For example, one person might be responsible for accounting, another might be in charge of marketing, and so on. Communication happens when employees share information with each other in order to make sure that everyone is on the same page. This can happen verbally or through written memos or emails.Using an analogy, explain specialization and communication within cells to a business student.Within cells, specialized proteins called enzymes carry out specific functions necessary for life such as breaking down food into molecules that the cell can use for energy. Cells also rely on communication to relay important messages and coordinate activities. For example, cells send signals telling muscles to contract during movement. Communication between cells allows them to work together like a well-oiled machine!	specialization and communication in a cell	Using an analogy, explain specialization and communication in a cell to a business student.	ht	business	1	In a business, specialization is when different employees are responsible for different tasks. For example, one person might be in charge of accounting, another might be in charge of marketing, and so on. Communication happens when employees share information with each other in order to make sure that everyone is on the same page. This can happen verbally or through written memos or emails.
Just as in a business, specialization occurs within cells. For example, one cell might be responsible for producing energy, another for digesting food, and so on. Communication between cells helps to ensure that all the different parts of the cell are functioning properly. In a business, communication happens when employees share information with each other in order to make sure that everyone is on the same page. This can happen verbally or through written memos or emails.	specialization and communication in a cell	Using an analogy, explain specialization and communication in a cell to a business student.	ht	business	1	In a business, specialization is when different employees are responsible for different tasks. Communication happens when these employees share information with each other in order to make sure that everyone is on the same page. This can happen verbally or through written memos or emails.In a cell, specialization happens when different parts of the cell are responsible for different tasks. For example, one part of the cell might be responsible for producing energy, another might be responsible for building new cells, and so on. Communication happens when these parts of the cell share information with each other in order to make sure that everything is running smoothly. This can happen verbally or through chemical signals	specialization and communication in a cell	Using an analogy, explain specialization and communication in a cell to a business student.	ht	business	1	In a business, specialization is when different employees are responsible for different tasks. For example, one person might be in charge of accounting, another might be in charge of marketing, and so on. Communication happens when employees share information with each other in order to make sure that everyone is on the same page. This can happen verbally or through written memos or emails.

In a business, employees specialize in different tasks in order to create a well-rounded and cohesive team. For example, one person might be responsible for accounting, another might be responsible for marketing, and so on. Communication happens when employees share information with each other in order to make sure that everyone is on the same page. This can happen verbally or through written memos or emails.On a cellular level, specialization happens when different parts of the cell are responsible for different tasks. The nucleus is responsible for directing the cell's activities, while the cytoplasm contains enzymes that catalyze chemical reactions. The mitochondria produce energy for the cell, and the plasma membrane surrounds and protects the cell. Communication between these specialized parts of the cell occurs when molecules called signal transduction proteins relay messages from one part of the cell to another.	specialization and communication in a cell	Using an analogy, explain specialization and communication in a cell to a business student.	ht	business	1	In a business, specialization is when different employees are responsible for different tasks. A good analogy for Kirchoff's Voltage Law is to think of water flowing through a hose. The water always flows in one direction and the sum of all the water pressure at any given point is zero. In an electrical circuit, electricity always flows in one direction and the sum of all the voltages at any given point is zero.	kirchoff's voltage law	Using an analogy, explain kirchoff's voltage law to a business student.	ht	business	1	Kirchoff's Voltage Law states that the sum of all voltages in a closed circuit is zero. To put it more simply, the law states that electricity always flows in one direction through a circuit and that there is no build-up of voltage or current. This law is important for business students because it helps to understand how electrical circuits work and how they can be used to power machines or appliances.
Kirchoff's voltage law can be explained using the analogy of water flow in a river. Just as the water always flows in one direction, electricity always flows in one direction through a circuit. There is no build-up of voltage or current, just like there is no build-up of water pressure when the river flows downstream. This law is important for business students because it helps to understand how electrical circuits work and how they can be used to power machines or appliances.	kirchoff's voltage law	Using an analogy, explain kirchoff's voltage law to a business student.	ht	business	1	Kirchoff's Voltage Law states that the sum of all voltages in a closed circuit is zero. To put it more simply, the law states that electricity always flows in one direction through a circuit and that there is no build-up of voltage or current. This law is important for business students because it helps to understand how electrical circuits work and how they can be used to power machines or appliances.
Kirchoff's Voltage Law can be explained using an analogy of water flowing through a hose. Imagine there is a blockage in the hose and the water can only flow in one direction. The pressure at the blockage is the same as at any other point in the hose. This is similar to how electricity flows through a circuit - it always flows in one direction and the voltage is equal at all points.	kirchoff's voltage law	Using an analogy, explain kirchoff's voltage law to a business student.	ht	business	1	Kirchoff's Voltage Law states that the sum of all voltages in a closed circuit is zero. And just as there is no build-up of pressure or current in the hose, there is no build-up of voltage or current in a circuit. This law is important for business students because it helps them understand how electrical circuits work and how they can be used to power machines or appliances.	kirchoff's voltage law	Using an analogy, explain kirchoff's voltage law to a business student.	ht	business	1	Kirchoff's Voltage Law states that the sum of all voltages in a closed circuit is zero. Kirchoff's Voltage Law is like a traffic law. Just as cars have to follow the rules of the road in order to keep traffic flowing smoothly, electricity has to obey certain laws (like Kirchoff's Voltage Law) in order for the circuit to work properly. If everyone followed the traffic laws, there would be fewer accidents and smoother traffic flow. The same is true for circuits - if everything follows the electrical laws, then the circuit will work correctly with no power shortages or malfunctions.	kirchoff's voltage law	Using an analogy, explain kirchoff's voltage law to a business student.	ht	business	1	Kirchoff's Voltage Law states that the sum of all voltages in a closed circuit is zero. A density wave is similar to a ripple that travels through water. The wave can be caused by something moving through the medium, such as a boat passing through water, or it can be generated by an outside force, such as wind blowing across the surface of the water. The waves created by movement are known as primary waves, while those created by outside forces are called secondary waves. Density waves are important in business because they can help companies measure and understand consumer sentiment. For example, if there is a large density wave traveling through a city, it could indicate that consumers are interested in buying a certain product or service. Companies can use this information to make decisions about where to allocate their resources.	nature of a density wave	Using an analogy, explain nature of a density wave to a business student.	ht	business	1	A density wave is a type of ripple that travels through a medium. The wave can be caused by something moving through the medium, such as a boat passing through water, or it can be generated by an outside force, such as wind blowing across the surface of the water. The waves created by movement are known as primary waves, while those created by outside forces are called secondary waves.
A density wave is like a crowd of people walking through a room. As each person walks through the room, they create a ripple that travels out from them. The waves created by movement are known as primary waves, while those created by outside forces are called secondary waves.	nature of a density wave	Using an analogy, explain nature of a density wave to a business student.	ht	business	1	A density wave is a type of ripple that travels through a medium. The waves created by movement are known as primary waves, while those created by outside forces are called secondary waves.

A density wave is a bit like the market trend of a certain stock. Say for example, ABC company is on an upward trend and more people are investing in the company. The demand for ABC company shares increases and causes the price of those shares to go up. This upward trend creates a ripple (or density wave) that spreads through the market as other investors buy into it as well.	nature of a density wave	Using an analogy, explain nature of a density wave to a business student.	ht	business	1	A density wave is a type of ripple that travels through a medium. A density wave is a bit like the ripple that travels outward when you toss a stone into a pond. The primary waves are created by the movement of the object (in this case, the stone) through the water, while the secondary waves are caused by the disturbance it creates in the water's surface.	nature of a density wave	Using an analogy, explain nature of a density wave to a business student.	ht	business	1	A density wave is a type of ripple that travels through a medium. Column chromatography is similar to a sorting machine at a post office. The compounds in the mixture are like letters and they move through the column at different rates, depending on their size, shape, and polarity. The most polar molecules are like large envelopes that move quickly while the least polar molecules are like small postcards that move slowly. At the end of the column, each compound is separated into its own individual container.	column chromatography	Using an analogy, explain column chromatography to a business student.	ht	business	1	Column chromatography is a technique used to separate mixtures of compounds. A column is packed with a solid material, such as silica gel or alumina, and the mixture is poured over the top. The compounds in the mixture will move through the column at different rates, depending on their size, shape, and polarity. The most polar molecules will move fastest while the least polar molecules will move slowest. At the end of the column, each compound will be separated into its own individual container.
Column chromatography can be thought of as a sorting machine. The different compounds in the mixture are like items going through a sorting line. The size, shape, and polarity of each compound determines how quickly it moves through the column. The most polar molecules move fastest while the least polar molecules move slowest. At the end of the column, each compound is separated into its own individual container. This process can be used to separate mixtures of compounds into their individual parts, just like a business can use a sorting machine to separate items by type or color.	column chromatography	Using an analogy, explain column chromatography to a business student.	ht	business	1	Column chromatography is a technique used to separate mixtures of compounds. A column is packed with a solid material, such as silica gel or alumina, and the mixture is poured over the top. The compounds in the mixture will move through the column at different rates, depending on their size, shape, and polarity. The most polar molecules will move fastest while the least polar molecules will move slowest. At the end of the column, each compound will be separated into its own individual container.
Column chromatography can be thought of as a way to separate mixtures of compounds into their individual parts. Just as different businesses have different specialties and cater to different markets, the compounds in a mixture will move through the column at different rates, depending on their size, shape, and polarity. The most polar molecules will move fastest while the least polar molecules will move slowest. At the end of the column, each compound will be separated into its own individual container. This process can be used to isolate specific compounds from a mixture or to purify them for further use.	column chromatography	Using an analogy, explain column chromatography to a business student.	ht	business	1	Column chromatography is a technique used to separate mixtures of compounds. A resonance hybrid is like a company with multiple owners. Each of the different types of atom in the molecule are like the different shareholders in the company. The atoms are held together by chemical bonds, which are like the business contracts between the shareholders. When a molecule is formed, the atoms will all try to get into the lowest energy state possible. This means that some of the atoms may have to change their state. In a resonance hybrid, there are more than one way for the atoms to get into the lowest energy state. This means that there are more than one way for the molecule to bond together.	resonance hybrid	Using an analogy, explain resonance hybrid to a business student.	ht	business	1	A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is made up of atoms from more than one element. The atoms are held together by chemical bonds. The different types of atom in the molecules can be in different states, called energy levels. When a molecule is formed, the atoms will all try to get into the lowest energy state possible. This means that some of the atoms may have to change their state. In a resonance hybrid, there are more than one way for the atoms to get into the lowest energy state. This means that there are more than one way for the molecule to bond together.
A resonance hybrid is like a company that has more than one CEO. Each CEO has their own way of running the company, but they all share the same goal. The different ways of running the company are like the different states that atoms can be in. When the company is formed, each CEO will try to get their group into the lowest energy state possible. This means that some of the groups may have to change their state. In a resonance hybrid, there are more than one way for the groups to get into the lowest energy state. This means that there are more than one way for the company to run	resonance hybrid	Using an analogy, explain resonance hybrid to a business student.	ht	business	1	A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is made up of atoms from more than one element. The atoms are held together by chemical bonds. The different types of atom in the molecules can be in different states, called energy levels. When a molecule is formed, the atoms will all try to get into the lowest energy state possible. This means that some of the atoms may have to change their state. In a resonance hybrid, there are more than one way for the atoms to get into the lowest energy state. This means that there are more than one way for the molecule to bond together.
Resonance hybrid is a lot like a company. There are different types of atoms (employees) and they are all held together by chemical bonds (the employer/employee relationship). The different types of atom can be in different states, called energy levels (hourly pay rate). When the molecule is formed, the atoms will all try to get into the lowest energy state possible (company making a profit). This means that some of the atoms may have to change their state. In a resonance hybrid, there are more than one way for the atoms to get into the lowest energy state. This means that there are more than one way for the molecule to bond together (company expanding).	resonance hybrid	Using an analogy, explain resonance hybrid to a business student.	ht	business	1	A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is made up of atoms from more than one element. A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is made up of atoms from more than one element. The atoms are held together by chemical bonds. The different types of atom in the molecules can be in different states, called energy levels. When a molecule is formed, the atoms will all try to get into the lowest energy state possible. This means that some of the atoms may have to change their state. In a resonance hybrid, there are more than one way for the atoms to get into the lowest energy state. This means that there are more than one way for the molecule to bond together.This analogy can be used to explain how businesses work as well. A business is like a molecule with its own energy levels (or departments). When it starts out, it has employees in all sorts of different positions (states or departments). However, over time it may find that it needs to reorganize and move some employees from department A to department B in order to save on costs or increase efficiency (lower its energy level). But unlike in chemistry where there is only one way for an atom to move around and form a new bond, businesses have multiple ways they can restructure without causing too much chaos (resonance hybrids). So while moving employees between departments may not always be easy, it's often better than starting from scratch	resonance hybrid	Using an analogy, explain resonance hybrid to a business student.	ht	business	1	A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is made up of atoms from more than one element. The atoms are held together by chemical bonds. The different types of atom in the molecules can be in different states, called energy levels. When a molecule is formed, the atoms will all try to get into the lowest energy state possible. This means that some of the atoms may have to change their state. In a resonance hybrid, there are more than one way for the atoms to get into the lowest energy state. This means that there are more than one way for the molecule to bond together.
A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is made up of atoms from more than one element. The atoms are held together by chemical bonds. The different types of atom in the molecules can be in different states, called energy levels. When a molecule is formed, the atoms will all try to get into the lowest energy state possible. This means that some of the atoms may have to change their state. In a resonance hybrid, there are more than one way for the atoms to get into the lowest energy state. This means that there are more than one way for the molecule to bond together.This example shows how Resonance Hybridization works: There are many ways for electrons to be distributed around an atom's nucleus (i.e., electron orbitals). But when bonding occurs between two atoms, only certain arrangements of these orbits will allow both atoms to complete their outer shells with eight electrons apiece (a stable configuration). In other words, chemists must consider not just what individual atomic orbitals look like but also how they interact with each other when two or more elements come together to form molecules .Now let's take a closer look at carbon monoxide (CO), which contains one carbon and one oxygen atom covalently bonded together: When we examine CO using Lewis structures—pictures that show lone pairs and bonds as lines between symbols representing individual atoms—we find three valid Lewis structures for this particular molecule: The first structure has a double bond between the carbons; Lone pairs occupy both oxygen "sp3" orbitals; There is no formal charge on any atom in this structure .The second structure has single bonds between the carbons; Lone pairs occupy both oxygen "sp2" orbitals; Formal charges on carbon (+1) and oxygen (-1) cancel out .The third structure also has single bonds between the carbons; Lone pair occupies only one oxygen "p" orbital ; Formal charge on carbon (+1) . None of these structures is better or worse than any other; they're all equally correct descriptions of CO molecular geometry. However, because none of them represents an especially stable arrangement of electron orbitals (remember our goal is eight filled outer shells), chemists don't typically think about CO in terms of these Lewis structures . Instead, they use something called a resonance hybrid , which is a weighted average representationof all three Lewis structures shown above : In this diagram, you can see that each dot represents an electron pair—and remember that two dots represent a shared pair of electrons: Notice how much weight each Lewis structure contributes to overall resonant hybrid? Structure 1 contributes 45 percent , Structure 2 contributes 35 percent , and Structure 3 contributes 20 percent . Again, this isn't meant to say that any givenLewis structureismore importantthan another—they're all equivalent representationsof Carbon Monoxide geometry —but it does mean that if we want to calculate something like CO's dipole moment (a measure of its polarity), we need account for all three contributingstructures !	resonance hybrid	Using an analogy, explain resonance hybrid to a business student.	ht	business	1	A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is made up of atoms from more than one element. The atoms are held together by chemical bonds. The different types of atom in the molecules can be in different states, called energy levels. When a molecule is formed, the atoms will all try to get into the lowest energy state possible. This means that some of the atoms may have to change their state. In a resonance hybrid, there are more than one way for the atoms to get into the lowest energy state. This means that there are more than one way for the molecule to bond together.
Consider a company as an atom. The different departments (marketing, accounting, etc.) within the company can be thought of as electron pairs. In order for the company to be stable (have a balanced budget), each department needs to share its electrons equally with the other departments. However, if one department has more than eight electrons (more work to do), it will attempt to share them with the other departments in order to achieve equilibrium. This process is called resonance. When this occurs, the electron pairs will move around until they are evenly distributed among all of the departments involved in resonance hybrid	resonance hybrid	Using an analogy, explain resonance hybrid to a business student.	ht	business	1	A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is composed of two or more atoms that are held together by covalent bonds. These atoms can be different elements, and they will share one or more pairs of electrons to form the bond. The molecules will have a stable configuration when all of the electron pairs are shared equally between the atoms. However, if an atom has more than eight electrons in its outer shell, it will attempt to share them with another atom in order to achieve a stable configuration. This process is called resonance. When this occurs, the electron pairs will move around until they are evenly distributed among all of the atoms involved in the resonance hybrid.
A resonance hybrid is like a big family. The atoms are all connected by covalent bonds, and they share electrons to form the bond. The molecules will have a stable configuration when all of the electron pairs are shared equally between the atoms. However, if an atom has more than eight electrons in its outer shell, it will try to share them with another atom in order to achieve a stable configuration. This process is called resonance. When this occurs, the electron pairs will move around until they are evenly distributed among all of the atoms involved in the resonance hybrid.	resonance hybrid	Using an analogy, explain resonance hybrid to a business student.	ht	business	1	A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is composed of two or more atoms that are held together by covalent bonds. These atoms can be different elements, and they will share one or more pairs of electrons to form the bond. The molecules will have a stable configuration when all of the electron pairs are shared equally between the atoms. However, if an atom has more than eight electrons in its outer shell, it will attempt to share them with another atom in order to achieve a stable configuration. This process is called resonance. When this occurs, the electron pairs will move around until they are evenly distributed among all of the atoms involved in the resonance hybrid.
A resonance hybrid is like a stable, balanced partnership between two or more business entities. Each atom involved in the bond shares an equal number of electrons (just as each company shares resources and responsibilities in a stable, productive alliance). And just as with any good partnership, when things get out of balance (one company starts to monopolize the resources), the equilibrium can be restored by moving some of those shared electrons around. In this way, resonance helps keep everything nicely organized and working together harmoniously.	resonance hybrid	Using an analogy, explain resonance hybrid to a business student.	ht	business	1	A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is composed of two or more atoms that are held together by covalent bonds. These atoms can be different elements, and they will share one or more pairs of electrons to form the bond. The molecules will have a stable configuration when all of the electron pairs are shared equally between the atoms. However, if an atom has more than eight electrons in its outer shell, it will attempt to share them with another atom in order to achieve a stable configuration. This process is called resonance. When this occurs, the electron pairs will move around until they are evenly distributed among all of the atoms involved in the resonance hybrid.
A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is composed of two or more atoms that are held together by covalent bonds. These atoms can be different elements, and they will share one or more pairs of electrons to form the bond. The molecules will have a stable configuration when all of the electron pairs are shared equally between the atoms. However, if an atom has more than eight electrons in its outer shell, it will attempt to share them with another atom in order to achieve a stable configuration. This process is called resonance. When this occurs, the electron pairs will move around until they are evenly distributed among all of the atoms involved in the resonance hybrid. In business, we can think about resonance hybrids as companies that have multiple brands under one roof. For example, PepsiCo has Pepsi and Frito-Lay under its umbrella, Disney has Marvel and Pixar under its banner, and Google owns both Android and YouTube	resonance hybrid	Using an analogy, explain resonance hybrid to a business student.	ht	business	1	A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is composed of two or more atoms that are held together by covalent bonds. These atoms can be different elements, and they will share one or more pairs of electrons to form the bond. The molecules will have a stable configuration when all of the electron pairs are shared equally between the atoms. However, if an atom has more than eight electrons in its outer shell, it will attempt to share them with another atom in order to achieve a stable configuration. This process is called resonance. When this occurs, the electron pairs will move around until they are evenly distributed among all of the atoms involved in the resonance hybrid.
Resonance hybrid can be thought of as a company with multiple shareholders. Each shareholder has an ownership stake in the company and contributes to its overall success. The shareholders work together to make decisions that benefit the company as a whole, and they share equally in the profits (or losses). In the same way, the atoms in a resonance hybrid share electrons equally to form a stable molecule.	resonance hybrid	Using an analogy, explain resonance hybrid to a business student.	ht	business	1	A resonance hybrid is a molecule that is composed of two or more atoms that are held together by covalent bonds. A wave mechanical model can be thought of as a way to explain how molecules move and interact with each other. Just as waves travel through the ocean, particles (molecules) can travel through a medium (such as air or water). The wavelength is the distance between two consecutive peaks in the wave, and the frequency is how many waves pass by in a given amount of time. This model can help us understand how molecules move and interact, which can be important for businesses that produce or use chemicals.	wave mechanical model	Using an analogy, explain wave mechanical model to a business student.	ht	business	1	In the wave mechanical model, particles are seen as waves that travel through a medium. The wavelength is the distance between two consecutive peaks in the wave, and the frequency is how many waves pass by in a given amount of time. This model can be used to help explain how molecules move and interact with each other.
In the wave mechanical model, particles are seen as waves that travel through a medium. The wavelength is the distance between two consecutive peaks in the wave, and the frequency is how many waves pass by in a given amount of time. This model can be used to help explain how molecules move and interact with each other.An example of how this might work in the business world would be if we looked at supply and demand for a product. The Wavelength would represent how often new stock (the product) becomes available, while Frequency would represent how often people are looking to buy that product. If there is high demand but low availability (think Apple products), then buyers will have to wait longer for new stock to become available because it takes longer for new waves (of stock) to reach them.	wave mechanical model	Using an analogy, explain wave mechanical model to a business student.	ht	business	1	In the wave mechanical model, particles are seen as waves that travel through a medium. The wave mechanical model is like a group of people walking through a crowd. The people are the waves, and the distance between them is the wavelength. Imagine a crowd of people at a football game. Each person is an individual wave, and the distance between each person is the wavelength. The number of waves passing by in a given amount of time is the frequency. Now imagine that someone starts pushing people closer together. This would decrease the wavelength, and increase the frequency. In other words, it would make more waves pass by in a shorter amount of time.	wave mechanical model	Using an analogy, explain wave mechanical model to a business student.	ht	business	1	In the wave mechanical model, particles are seen as waves that travel through a medium. The electroencephalogram is a brain scan that records the electrical activity of your brain. This information can be used to diagnose problems with your brain, such as seizures or tumors. The electroencephalogram works by measuring the voltage between two points on your scalp. This information can be used to create a graph that shows the different types of brain activity occurring at any given time.	electroencephalogram	Using an analogy, explain electroencephalogram to a business student.	ht	business	0	The electroencephalogram is a brain scan that records the electrical activity of your brain. An electroencephalogram (EEG) is a test that measures the electrical activity in your brain. This activity can be used to help diagnose problems with your brain, such as seizures or tumors. The EEG measures the voltage between different points on your scalp. This gives an indication of the amount of electric current being generated by different parts of your brain. The EEG can be used to identify any abnormal patterns of electrical activity in your brain.	electroencephalogram	Using an analogy, explain electroencephalogram to a business student.	ht	business	0	An electroencephalogram (EEG) is a test that measures the electrical activity in your brain. When an action potential is generated at the nerve cell body, it travels down the axon to the synaptic terminals. There, it causes neurotransmitters to be released into the synapse. These neurotransmitters cross the synaptic gap and bind to receptors on the next neuron, causing another action potential. This process continues until the message reaches its target muscle or organ. In other words, propagation of an action potential down a neuron is similar to how a message travels from one business person to another. The message starts with a initial spark (the generator), and then spreads through everyone in close proximity (the transmitter).	propagation of an action potential down a neuron	Using an analogy, explain propagation of an action potential down a neuron to a business student.	ht	business	1	When an action potential is generated at the nerve cell body, it travels down the axon to the synaptic terminals. There, it causes neurotransmitters to be released into the synapse. These neurotransmitters cross the synaptic gap and bind to receptors on the next neuron, causing another action potential. This process continues until the message reaches its target muscle or organ.
Propagation of an action potential down a neuron is similar to the spread of news or information from one person to another. An action potential starts at the nerve cell body, just like when someone shares news with others in a group. The message then travels down the axon to the synaptic terminals, analogous to people passing along information verbally. At the synaptic terminals, neurotransmitters are released into the synapse and bind to receptors on the next neuron, causing another action potential. This process continues until the message reaches its target muscle or organ. In this analogy, each step represents someone sharing news with new individuals, and each individual receiving news is analogous to a receptor binding neurotransmitters.	propagation of an action potential down a neuron	Using an analogy, explain propagation of an action potential down a neuron to a business student.	ht	business	1	When an action potential is generated at the nerve cell body, it travels down the axon to the synaptic terminals. There, it causes neurotransmitters to be released into the synapse. These neurotransmitters cross the synaptic gap and bind to receptors on the next neuron, causing another action potential. This process continues until the message reaches its target muscle or organ.
The propagation of an action potential down a neuron can be likened to the spread of news or rumors in a business. An initial spark or event (the generation of the action potential) starts things off and quickly spreads to other people in the company (neurons). The farther away from the originator someone is, the less detail they will have about what transpired, just as with neurotransmitters traveling across a synaptic gap. In order for the message to reach its final destination (a muscle or organ), it must pass through many different individuals within the company (synapses), each one relaying only part of the story.	propagation of an action potential down a neuron	Using an analogy, explain propagation of an action potential down a neuron to a business student.	ht	business	1	When an action potential is generated at the nerve cell body, it travels down the axon to the synaptic terminals. There, it causes neurotransmitters to be released into the synapse. These neurotransmitters cross the synaptic gap and bind to receptors on the next neuron, causing another action potential. This process continues until the message reaches its target muscle or organ.
The action potential is like an email that gets sent from the nerve cell body to the synaptic terminals. The neurotransmitters are like the email attachments, and they cross the synaptic gap and bind to receptors on the next neuron. This process continues until the message reaches its target muscle or organ.	propagation of an action potential down a neuron	Using an analogy, explain propagation of an action potential down a neuron to a business student.	ht	business	1	When an action potential is generated at the nerve cell body, it travels down the axon to the synaptic terminals. There, it causes neurotransmitters to be released into the synapse. These neurotransmitters cross the synaptic gap and bind to receptors on the next neuron, causing another action potential. This process continues until the message reaches its target muscle or organ.
When the boss makes an announcement, it travels down the office hallway to where all of the employees are working. The message is then transmitted from one employee to another until it reaches its final destination. This is similar to how an action potential travels down a neuron to a muscle or organ.	propagation of an action potential down a neuron	Using an analogy, explain propagation of an action potential down a neuron to a business student.	ht	business	1	When an action potential is generated at the nerve cell body, it travels down the axon to the synaptic terminals. A layered architecture can be thought of as an onion. The outermost layer is the presentation layer, which is responsible for displaying information to users. The next layer in, the business logic layer, handles all of the business rules and calculations. The data access layer provides access to the underlying database. And finally, the database layer stores all of the data used by the application. This way, if something goes wrong with one element of the system, it doesn't take down the whole system.	layered architecture	Using an analogy, explain layered architecture to a business student.	ht	business	1	A layered architecture is a way of organizing computer systems so that the most important elements are at the top and the least important elements are at the bottom. This way, if something goes wrong with one element of the system, it doesn't take down the whole system. The different layers in a layered architecture can be described as follows: The presentation layer is responsible for displaying information to users. The business logic layer handles all of the business rules and calculations. The data access layer provides access to the underlying database. And finally, the database layer stores all of the data used by the application.
A layered architecture is like a layer cake. The most important elements are at the top, and the least important elements are at the bottom. This way, if something goes wrong with one element of the system, it doesn't take down the whole system.	layered architecture	Using an analogy, explain layered architecture to a business student.	ht	business	1	A layered architecture is a way of organizing computer systems so that the most important elements are at the top and the least important elements are at the bottom. The different layers in a layered architecture can be described as follows: The presentation layer is responsible for displaying information to users. The business logic layer handles all of the business rules and calculations. The data access layer provides access to the underlying database. And finally, the database layer stores all of the data used by the application.
A layered architecture can be thought of as a building. The most important elements are at the top and the least important elements are at the bottom. This way, if something goes wrong with one element of the system, it doesn't take down the whole system.
